question: What are your greatest strengths and how do they apply to this role?
transcript: My strength I think it has attention to details. I have very very very attention and details. I'm eager to make everything perfect. I love making things on time. I can work on the project. So I think all of this makes me qualified for this job.

answer_evaluation.question: What are your greatest strengths and how do they apply to this role?

scores.name: Relevance
scores.explanation: The response identifies relevant strengths and attention to detail but lacks specific examples of how these qualities apply to the role.

scores.name: Clarity
scores.explanation: The response is repetitive, lacks coherence, and is not clearly structured.

scores.name: Professionalism
scores.explanation: The tone is informal, lacks professional polish, and includes redundant phrases, reducing overall professionalism.

scores.name: Depth of Insight
scores.explanation: The response provides limited insight and lacks detailed examples regarding how the candidate's strengths and qualifications apply to the role.

scores.name: Positivity
scores.explanation: The answer is positive, emphasizing strengths, capabilities, eagerness, and punctuality.

scores.name: Engagement
scores.explanation: The response fails to invite further discussion or effectively engage the interviewer.

scores.name: Adaptability
scores.explanation: The response mentions adaptability and general skills but lacks clear examples or connections to the role.
